intro: Stellaria congestiflora, commonly known as the clustered starwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Europe. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as carnations and sweet William. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Stellaria congestiflora typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks.
